title: Unemployment Claims Climbed to 200,000 Last Week
sub_head: The increase was the first since early April and comes amid other signs of a tight U.S. labor market
body:
New applications for unemployment benefits rose last week for the first time since early April amid other signs the U.S. labor market remains unusually tight.
Initial jobless claims, a proxy for layoffs, increased by 19,000 to 200,000 last week from the previous weekâ€™s revised level of 181,000, the Labor Department said Thursday.
